discussion.p:
The syntactic distinction between a function concept and a variable concept seems to serve no useful purpose. A single concept syntax seems sufficient, and especially so once redundant elements are removed.
Merge the two concept forms into one, streamlining the syntax by eliminating at least the following redundant elements: explicit bool (see comment below), explicit return, and the always empty parentheses constituting the function parameter list.
Also see issues and as they relate.
